page.title: 15THE VILLAGE SIGN,WARBOYS
page.content: The {village sign}is in the centre of the village at the Y-junction. It is in front of the pond called the weir (pronounced "ware"). In 1980 a group from the Women's Institute thought that it would be good if the village could have a village sign. A meeting was held and it was agreed to go ahead and raise money. Money ws raised by holding jumble sales,coffee mornings,bingo and a fashion show. A competition was launched in which people were asked to submit their ideas for the sign. Many children from the school entered the competition. The final design was composed of parts of the winning designs which were thought to represent life in Warboys. The sign was made and painted by Mr. Howard Carter of Swaffam, Norfolk.
